bugs.title: CVE-2015-1838 salt: insecure /tmp file handling in salt/modules/serverdensity_device.py

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2015-1838 salt: insecure /tmp file handling in salt/modules/serverdensity_device.py

long_desc.thetext:
Michael Scherer of Red Hat reported an insecure /tmp file handling in salt/modules/serverdensity_device.py in SaltStack.
This issue is fixed in SaltStack version 2014.7.4 with this commit:

https://github.com/saltstack/salt/commit/e11298d7155e9982749483ca5538e46090caef9c

External References:

http://docs.saltstack.com/en/latest/topics/releases/2014.7.4.html

Acknowledgements:

Red Hat would like to thank Michael Scherer of Red Hat for reporting this issue.

Statement:

This issue did not affect versions of salt as shipped with Red Hat Red Hat Ceph Storage as they did not include the vulnerable module.

Created salt tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1212789]
Affects: epel-all [bug 1212790]
salt-2015.5.8-1.fc23 has been pushed to the Fedora 23 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

bugs.title: CVE-2015-1839 salt: insecure /tmp file handling in salt/modules/chef.py

long_desc.thetext:
Michael Scherer of Red Hat reported an insecure /tmp file handling in salt/modules/chef.py in SaltStack.

https://github.com/saltstack/salt/commit/22d2f7a1ec93300c34e8c42d14ec39d51e610b5c
https://github.com/saltstack/salt/commit/b49d0d4b5ca5c6f31f03e2caf97cef1088eeed81

External References:

http://docs.saltstack.com/en/latest/topics/releases/2014.7.4.html

Acknowledgements:

Red Hat would like to thank Michael Scherer of Red Hat for reporting this issue.

Statement:

This issue did not affect versions of salt as shipped with Red Hat Red Hat Ceph Storage as they did not include the vulnerable module.

Created salt tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1212789]
Affects: epel-all [bug 1212790]

bugs.title: salt: git module leaks authentication details into log [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: salt: git module leaks authentication details into log [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2015-6918 salt: git module leaks authentication details into log

long_desc.thetext:
It was found that calling git.clone with https user/pass will leak the authentication details to the log.

Upstream patch:

https://github.com/saltstack/salt/commit/28aa9b105804ff433d8f663b2f9b804f2b75495a

Created salt tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1257155]
Affects: epel-all [bug 1257156]

Analysis:

Salt git module is affected in Ceph, but git module is not used by ceph  in production environment. Hence Ceph itself is not affected by this vulnerability but shipped salt git module is.

Just to add some more info here, the auth info was only being leaked at the debug loglevel. Salt ships with the loglevel set to "warning" by default, so the issue would not present itself unless the loglevel was intentionally changed to debug.

2015.5.8 builds were submitted today as updates for the Fedora and EPEL branches, which includes fixes to redact HTTPS basic auth credentials.

bugs.title: CVE-2015-6941 salt: win_useradd module and salt-cloud display passwords in debug log [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2015-6941 salt: win_useradd module and salt-cloud display passwords in debug log [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2015-6941 salt: win_useradd module and salt-cloud display passwords in debug log

long_desc.thetext:
A vulnerability in win_useradd, salt-cloud and Linode driver were found:

* win_useradd returned data including the password of the newly created user
* salt-cloud debug output contained win_password and sudo_password authentication credentials
* Linode driver displayed authentication credentials in debug logs

Upstream patch:

https://github.com/twangboy/salt/commit/c0689e32154c41f59840ae10ffc5fbfa30618710

External reference:

https://docs.saltstack.com/en/latest/topics/releases/2015.8.1.html
https://docs.saltstack.com/en/latest/topics/releases/2015.5.6.html

Created salt tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1273068]
Affects: epel-all [bug 1273070]

Created salt-cloud tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1273069]
Affects: epel-all [bug 1273071]

bugs.title: Urgent bug fix back-ported to salt 2015.5.5 (same version as EPEL) by upstream not yet made it into EPEL.

bugzilla.short_desc: Urgent bug fix back-ported to salt 2015.5.5 (same version as EPEL) by upstream not yet made it into EPEL.

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
Multiple salt modules encounter errors due to a bug introduced in salt 2015.5.3.  See this upstream bug report: https://github.com/saltstack/salt/issues/26280

Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
2015.5.5

How reproducible:
Known bug - see upstream bug report, which includes docker templates to reproduce the fault.

Steps to Reproduce:
See upstream bug report, which includes docker templates to reproduce the fault

Actual results:
Stacktrace

Expected results:
Runs correctly.

Additional info:
Upstream have back-ported the fix to 2015.5.5 - the rpm should just need re-rolling as a new release of the same version.

See upstream merge to backport fix into 2015.5.5 branch: https://github.com/saltstack/salt/pull/27681/
Any love for an update ? We are at 2015.5.8 now (at 2015.8.3 for the new release)
I will be looking into it this week.
salt-2015.5.8-1.fc23 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 23. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-105b3b8804

Sorry for the delay, I was looking into ways to get 2015.8 built on Fedora/EPEL, but our requirements for a couple of the dependencies will make that impossible. Instead, I've updated EPEL and Fedora to the latest release in the 2015.5 release cycle.
Thanks. Any idea when I can expect 2015.5.8 for el7 ?

salt-2015.5.8-1.fc23 has been pushed to the Fedora 23 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for
instructions on how to install test updates.
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-105b3b8804

It was accepted into epel-testing 18 hours ago. Depending on how often mirrors sync, it may already be available to be installed from there.

yum --enablerepo=epel-testing install salt-minion

Packages submitted to the FBS for epel have a 2-week waiting period before they can be pushed to the stable epel repos. Builds with enough votes are automatically pushed to stable. If, after installing from epel-testing and confirming that it works to your satisfaction, you'd like to upvote the build, you can do so at the following link:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2016-039bf0137a
salt-2015.5.8-1.fc23 has been pushed to the Fedora 23 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

bugs.title: CVE-2015-8034 salt: Information leak from state.sls cache data stored as world-readable [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2015-8034 salt: Information leak from state.sls cache data stored as world-readable [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2015-8034 salt: Information leak from state.sls cache data stored as world-readable

long_desc.thetext:
It was found that state.sls function stores state run cache on the minion onto the disk with incorrect permissions, making it world-readable. This file could potentially contain sensitive data that was inserted via jinja into the state SLS files.

Upstream bug report:

https://github.com/saltstack/salt/issues/28455

Upstream patch:

https://github.com/cachedout/salt/commit/097838ec0c52b1e96f7f761e5fb3cd7e79808741

Created salt tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1289110]
Affects: epel-all [bug 1289111]
The 2015.5.9 builds currently in testing include this patch already.
Actually, the 2015.5.8 builds in stable also include this patch, so I'm going to close this.

(In reply to Erik Johnson from comment #3)
> Actually, the 2015.5.8 builds in stable also include this patch, so I'm
> going to close this.

Please do not close CVE bugs, these bugs are supposed to be closed by Red Hat's Product Security after the issue is fixed in all its products.

Thanks

OK, but the issue *is* fixed. 2015.5.8 is in stable. What is the path to getting this issue closed, then, since I didn't add the bug number when I submitted the 2015.5.8 builds to bodhi?

I did add this bug to the 2015.5.9 builds of Salt currently in testing, before I realized that the issue was already resolved in 2015.5.8.
salt-2015.5.9-2.fc22 has been pushed to the Fedora 22 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
